Award.AwardTitle: Planck Scale Holographic Noise Search Experiment
Award.AbstractNarration:
The Holometer experiment at Fermilab is designed to study a conjectured effect called "holographic noise" that may arise from new Planck scale physics: the measured positions of bodies may wander randomly from the geodesics of classical relativity, in measurement-dependent directions by about a Planck length per Planck time. The experiment will search for this holographic jitter in the relation of mass energy and space time by looking for correlated phase noise between two neighboring interferometers to provide convincing evidence for or against the hypothesized effect. A positive result would be a major step forward in understanding the emergence of space-time and mass-energy from a unified theory of gravity, space-time and quantum mechanics. A negative result will impact the macroscopic interpretation of unified theories.

This award will enable the PI to collaborate in the search for Holographic Planck Scale Noise. The experiment, under construction and testing at Fermilab, will search for the correlation of the two noise signals from two nearby simple Michelson Interferometers. This correlated noise should depend on the relative displacement and orientation of the two interferometers, thus making incisive tests possible. This experiment will be the first targeted specifically to measure this fundamental minimum interval of space-time. It could make the first direct measurement of a universal noise in space-time caused by that fundamental Planck scale graininess.

Broader Impacts: Apart from the possibly very significant impact on physics and the way space-time is viewed, even a negative result would provide strong graduate physics training and an excellent career launching experience. This experiment is a good hands-on physics project, with multiple opportunities for real mentor contact, and with the experimental reality of debugging, diagnosing and making measurements; the PI has a strong personal outreach program to undergraduates and has mentored undergraduates in summer research projects for more than 10 years.

POR.DRECONTENT:
We search for the "size"  Lp, of fundamental space-time units: Planck Scale ; ie Lp = sqrt(Gnewton * hPlanck / c 3  ) = 1.6 10  -35   meters  or 10 -45 sec, very small, with suggestive fundamental units.   At this distance Quantum Mechanics and General Relativity conflict,  and a more encompassing theory/explanation of the universe, space-time as we know it, needs to be found: "Quantum Gravity", for which we have only vague notions.  HOLOGRAPHIC Planck scale noise is a compelling notion proposed by Craig Hogan of Fermilab Astrophysics ( with predictions; testable ). In this physical HOLOGRAPHIC view, space is dynamically  2 + 1 dimensional, as seen in the Hawking view of Black Hole thermodynamics: the entrophy of a Black Hole  S = Schwrtzshild.Area/4 in square Lp Area units.  "Holographic" is the notion all information in a spacetime volume is encoded on the surface of that volume.  A heuristic Gustafson picture is space becoming fuzzy, perhaps "boiling", as one looks smaller in conventional ways, at smaller, and smaller sizes, yet consistent with the Hawking view.. The paradigm has to refine or change.

      We probe this ultimate wiggly level of space with optical beams of 2 Laser Interferometers.

In Craig Hogans HOLOGRAPHIC picture, the distance along a propagating probe beam, eg laser INTERFEROMETER (IFO) beam), is time, and the Planck Scale length fuzziness is in the direction of, about the transverse observation directions; this noise is the same for "nearby" beams, (propagating photon states), eg .5m in our two proximate IFO detectors (see Feb 2012 Scientific American p30: an elementary tutorial of HOLO ideas).  The HOLO noise signal can be thought of as a random walk of Planck scale "steps" per Planck time.  It is "predicted" to be about 1.1 10-22 m/sqrtHz apparent IFO beam splitter mirror noise of a 40 m interferometer (IFO) mirror; shear mode.  

The goal is to detect, measure, this noise signal, at this level. Thus we'd give credence and direction to refining the concepts, illuminate, lead, our notions of quantum space time, and suggest further explorartory experimental investigations.

The signal paradigm has evolved over the experiment.  We now "recognize" two compelling possible Noise signal forms: shear, and rotational "  wiggles" of space. We rename: HOLO1  = shear mode distortions,  and HOLO2 = rotational mode distortions, about every fixed IFO point/direction  eg a beam splitter - arm system.  [see arXiv160703048, arXiv1312.7798]

Our HOLO1 scheme for detection is to detect-measure the correlated noise signal seen by two close  (.6 m)  40m interferometers ( IFO's ).  The Hogan Planck scale noise signal is about 1% of our IFO quantum shot noise.  A signal would be seeing from IFO1 to IFO2,   correlated noise signals over the responding frequency range, ( ~ flat up to about 3 - 10 MHz shear noise, or 6 - 18 MHz rotational noise), then rolling off, perhaps at ~ 6 dB/octave above this corner frequency   set by the IFO arm lengths and relative geometry.

   This correlation is the Planck Scale discovery signal. 

The small  (1% of shot noise signal)  is derived by calculating  IFO1 - IFO2 correlation over many! short data stretches:  digitized RF IFO signals over 1 second intervals from the two IFO's are recorded: correlations are computed, saved; and averaged over   100 to 800 hour -  like run periods.  The operational proceedures, theory, paradigms, and data analysis, continues to evolve.

>  We have devised, designed, built, shaken down conceptually and operationally, run,  a Planck scale shear noise search at the 1.2 10^-22m IFO level.

>   HOLO1: No  Shear Signal was seen  at the few % "Planck level, in "HOLO1" configuration.

 The new Rotational second Planck Noise Signal scenario ( HOLO2 ) features a search for Rotational Planck scale noise at the Planck area level; this is more compelling in conception and calculation, with the predicted signal less subject to ad hoc 20% corrections of the the expected signal. A  modest IFO reconfiguration/rebuild  (10 months) was involved, for first look, featuring a 90 degree bend in each of two corresponding  nested IFO arms. The sensitivity is somewhat higher, calculated "applying" quantum mechanics to spacetime rotational    wiggles.  Hogan  arXiv1509.07997.  

>   HOLO2: We SEEM to see a Rotational signal at the 4 sigma level!    first operational results of HOLO2.  But result  has the feature  of having a 90 degree IFO-IFO correlation phase: not understood, but ideas in investigation, test. 

Positive?   We think so.   Yet to verify.

This is cutting edge micro-cosmology of the universe. 

Investigations of IFO operation, conception, and theory continue.

NSF1205254 grant (stretched) has supported Michigan over 6 years, including an undergrad, 2 posdocs, and Gustafson, travel plus hardware supplys.

We will run/test more, seek funds/resources to improve extend the HOLO2 system, and sustain effort    to verify this result.

HOLO is E990 at Fermilab; with collaborators from UChicago, Caltech, MIT, Vanderbilt, Fermilab, Michigan.
